Click the Flic you want to add once
Bluetooth is OFF
Turn on bluetooth and try again
Bluetooth is OFF
The communication between your device and your Flic is made possible via Bluetooth and is therefore necessary at all times.
Couldn\'t find any flics
Make sure your Flic is within reach when you click
Couldn\'t find any flics

When the app is in search mode, make sure your physical Flic is very close to this device and that you click it once so that it starts broadcasting. You have 10 seconds to do this.

If you still have trouble finding your new Flic make sure it is in Public Mode. You can enable Public Mode on your Flic by Holding it down for 7 seconds.

In rare events your device might have a problem. Please try restarting the Bluetooth and/or your device. If that doesn't work, feel free to contact us at support@flic.io.
Found new Flic, connecting…
This can take a few seconds
Couldn\'t connect to Flic
Something went wrong and a connection to the Flic could not be established. In some rare cases the bluetooth or the device has to be restarted. Try again or contact us at support@flic.io
Your Flic is in Private Mode
Click & hold for 6 seconds to unlock it
Your Flic is in Private Mode

This probably means that your Flic has been connected to a device before, and is therefore locked in order to prevent other devices from picking it up. To connect it to this device you have to set it to Public Mode. 


Put Flic in Public Mode:

Hold down your Flic for 7 seconds. It should blink during this period. When the blinking stops, wait a few seconds and press "TRY AGAIN".
Couldn\'t reach Flic-server
Make sure you are connected to Internet using WIFI or mobile data and try again
Couldn\'t reach Flic-server

Before you can use a new Flic, it must be verified and unlocked against our servers, which requires an Internet connection.\n\nWhen this is done, all communication between the Flic and this device is made through Bluetooth.
